intro: Minuartia diljanae, commonly known as the Balkan sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as steppes and forest margins. Minuartia diljanae is a perennial species that is relatively rare and has limited distribution within its native range.
